column1: Hending was a Hobbits of the Shire.
Hending was the fourth child of Holman the greenhanded.
The name in Middle English means "courteous
column4: "Giving of Names" In Gerald of Wales on the Survival of Welsh
column5: Tolkien equates the name "Hending" — nominally the author of a compilation of traditional proverbs that end with "quoth Hending" —  with the Welsh "henddyn"
column6: the typical wise old man.Mark T. Hooker
